page.title: 06PONDS
page.content: Of the 14 mentioned in the Oxfordshire Hundreds as once surrounding the Green only 3 ponds remain. The first,although it is 'on the Green' and hence common property,is known as the School Pond, being situated in front of the School- House. Certainly the pupils enjoy pond dipping though,fortunately the pond is well fenced on the school side. Unfortunately reed mace was introduced in the past and it has 'taken over' to such an extent that a major effort by a conservation group has been necessary to clear the pond. A second pond is across the Green from the School outside Durham Leys Farm. This is easily accessible but far from ornamental. The third pond, smallest of the three, is on the property of College Farm and can be reached only by walking across the fields.
